Metadata.siteFullName: The Junior Assembly of the Model United Nations
Metadata.defaultTitle: Model UN & Academic Competitions for Grades 5-8 | JAMUN
Metadata.defaultDescription: Affordable academic competition programs for middle school students (grades 5-8). Build public speaking, critical thinking, debate, and leadership skills through Model UN, Mock Trial, and Mathletes competitions. Grants available.

StructuredData.modelUNProgramDescription: Learn diplomatic skills, global issues analysis, public speaking, and resolution writing through our Model UN program designed for middle school students in grades 5-8.
StructuredData.mockTrialProgramDescription: Learn legal reasoning, cross-examination, opening statements, and persuasive argumentation through courtroom simulation designed for middle school students in grades 5-8.
StructuredData.mathletesProgramDescription: Prepare for MATHCOUNTS, AMC 8, and Math League competitions through team-based competitive math training designed for middle school students in grades 5-8.

ProgramsPageMetadata.title: Best Academic Programs for Middle School Students
ProgramsPageMetadata.description: Explore JAMUN's three academic competition programs for grades 5-8: Model UN (diplomacy & debate), Mock Trial (legal advocacy), and Mathletes (competitive math). Free resources, beginner-friendly, real competitions.
ProgramsPageMetadata.ogTitle: Three Academic Programs for Middle School Excellence
ProgramsPageMetadata.ogDescription: Model UN, Mock Trial, and Mathletes - three paths to developing public speaking, critical thinking, and leadership skills. Beginner-friendly programs for grades 5-8.

ModelUNPageMetadata.title: Model UN for Middle School - Conferences & Resources
ModelUNPageMetadata.description: Join JAMUN's Model United Nations program for grades 5-8. Learn diplomatic skills, global issues, public speaking, and resolution writing. Beginner-friendly conferences, position paper guides, and free resources.
ModelUNPageMetadata.ogTitle: Model UN for Middle School - JAMUN
ModelUNPageMetadata.ogDescription: Step into the shoes of UN delegates and tackle real-world global issues. Develop public speaking, research, and negotiation skills. Free resources and low-cost conferences.

MockTrialPageMetadata.title: Mock Trial for Middle School - Learn Courtroom Skills
MockTrialPageMetadata.description: Experience courtroom drama in JAMUN's Mock Trial program for grades 5-8. Learn legal reasoning, cross-examination, opening statements, and persuasive argumentation. Build confidence in public speaking and critical thinking.
MockTrialPageMetadata.ogTitle: Mock Trial for Middle School - JAMUN
MockTrialPageMetadata.ogDescription: Learn to think like a lawyer! Develop argumentation, critical analysis, and presentation skills through courtroom simulation. Launching Fall 2026.

MathletesPageMetadata.title: Mathletes for Grades 5-8 - Math Competitions
MathletesPageMetadata.description: Join JAMUN's Mathletes program for grades 5-8. Prepare for MATHCOUNTS, AMC 8, and Math League competitions. Develop problem-solving skills, number theory, algebra, and geometry through team-based competitive math.
MathletesPageMetadata.ogTitle: Mathletes - Competitive Math for Middle School - JAMUN
MathletesPageMetadata.ogDescription: Challenge yourself with competitive mathematics! Build analytical thinking, speed, and accuracy through engaging math competitions. Prepare for MATHCOUNTS and AMC 8.

AboutPageMetadata.title: About JAMUN - Youth-Led Nonprofit for Grades 5-8
AboutPageMetadata.description: Learn about JAMUN, a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization run by high school and college students. Discover our mission to make academic competitions accessible to all middle school students through Model UN, Mock Trial, and Mathletes.
AboutPageMetadata.ogTitle: About JAMUN - Youth-Led Academic Competition Nonprofit
AboutPageMetadata.ogDescription: JAMUN is 100% youth-led and volunteer-run. With 500+ students impacted and 80+ volunteers, we're making academic competitions accessible to all middle schoolers.

DonatePageMetadata.title: Support Middle School Academic Programs - Donate to JAMUN
DonatePageMetadata.description: Support JAMUN's mission to make academic competitions accessible to all middle school students. Your tax-deductible donation funds Model UN, Mock Trial, and Mathletes programs for underserved schools. 501(c)(3) nonprofit.
DonatePageMetadata.ogTitle: Donate to JAMUN - Every Gift Changes a Student's Life
DonatePageMetadata.ogDescription: Help bring Model UN, Mock Trial, and Mathletes to middle schoolers who might never get the chance otherwise. 100% volunteer-run nonprofit.

GrantsPageMetadata.title: Conference Grants for Students - Up to 100% Covered
GrantsPageMetadata.description: Apply for JAMUN grants to cover registration fees, travel costs, and materials for Model UN, Mock Trial, and Mathletes competitions. Financial assistance for middle school students and schools. Free application.
GrantsPageMetadata.ogTitle: Apply for JAMUN Student Grants - Cost Shouldn't Determine Participation
GrantsPageMetadata.ogDescription: Get financial assistance for Model UN, Mock Trial, and Mathletes competitions. 100+ students funded, $25K+ grants given. Simple application process.

LeaderboardsPageMetadata.title: Competition Rankings - Model UN, Mock Trial, Math
LeaderboardsPageMetadata.description: View JAMUN competition leaderboards for Model UN, Mock Trial, and Mathletes. Track school rankings, top delegates, and team performance across our academic competition programs.

PrivacyPageMetadata.description: JAMUN's privacy policy explains how we collect, use, and protect your personal information. Learn about our data practices and your privacy rights.

BlogPageMetadata.title: Tips & Guides for Academic Competitions
BlogPageMetadata.description: Expert guides for Model UN position papers, Mock Trial cross-examination, and math competition strategies. Student success stories, delegate tips, and resources for middle school academic competitions.
BlogPageMetadata.ogTitle: JAMUN Blog - Academic Competition Tips & Resources
BlogPageMetadata.ogDescription: Discover strategies to excel in Model UN, Mock Trial, and Mathletes. Expert guides, student stories, and tips for middle school competitors.

CommitteesPageMetadata.title: Model UN Committees - Beginner to Advanced
CommitteesPageMetadata.description: Explore JAMUN's Model UN committees including General Assembly, Security Council, ECOSOC, and specialized agencies. Find the perfect committee for middle school delegates at our beginner-friendly conferences.
CommitteesPageMetadata.ogDescription: Explore our diverse Model UN committees designed for middle school delegates. From General Assembly to Security Council, find your perfect fit.

ResourcesPageMetadata.title: Free Model UN Guides & Templates for Students
ResourcesPageMetadata.description: Free Model UN resources for middle school delegates. Learn to write position papers, draft resolutions, give speeches, and master parliamentary procedure. Beginner guides and advanced strategies.

ResourcesPageMetadata.ogDescription: Everything you need to succeed in Model UN: position paper templates, resolution guides, speech tips, and parliamentary procedure tutorials.

MockTrialResourcesPageMetadata.ogDescription: Master courtroom skills: cross-examination, opening statements, objections, and case analysis. Free guides for student attorneys and witnesses.

MathletesResourcesPageMetadata.title: Free Math Competition Resources - MATHCOUNTS & AMC 8 Prep
MathletesResourcesPageMetadata.description: Free math competition resources for middle school students. Prepare for MATHCOUNTS, AMC 8, and Math League with practice problems, strategies, and study guides. Number theory, algebra, and geometry tutorials.
MathletesResourcesPageMetadata.ogTitle: Free Math Competition Resources - JAMUN Mathletes
MathletesResourcesPageMetadata.ogDescription: Prepare for MATHCOUNTS and AMC 8: practice problems, problem-solving strategies, and topic guides for competitive math.

Footer.tagline: Empowering students through competitive academic excellence and meaningful debate.

TranslationNotice.title: "Everyone" means everyone.
TranslationNotice.subtitle: Accessibility matters to us
TranslationNotice.message1: We believe academic competitions should be accessible to all students, regardless of language. That's why we're working to translate our resources into multiple languages.
TranslationNotice.message2: Please note: Some translations may be incomplete or contain errors. If you notice any issues, we'd love your help improving them.

HomePage.title: JAMUN - Affordable Middle School Academic Competitions | Model UN, Mock Trial, Mathletes
HomePage.description: JAMUN offers low-cost academic competition programs for middle school students (grades 5-8). Build public speaking, critical thinking, leadership, and debate skills through Model UN, Mock Trial, and Mathletes. Grants available. 100% youth-led nonprofit.
HomePage.ogTitle: JAMUN - Affordable Middle School Academic Competitions
HomePage.ogDescription: Join 500+ students in Model UN, Mock Trial, and Mathletes. Build public speaking, critical thinking, and leadership skills. Low-cost programs for grades 5-8 with grants available.

StatsSection.title: Empowering Young Leaders Nationwide
StatsSection.subtitle: JAMUN is a 100% volunteer-run nonprofit making academic competitions accessible to middle school students across the country.

WhoWeServeSection.title: Programs for Students, Parents & Educators
WhoWeServeSection.subtitle: JAMUN provides academic competition programs designed specifically for middle school students. Our Model UN, Mock Trial, and Mathletes programs help young learners build confidence, develop critical skills, and discover their potential. Free resources and low-cost conferences with grants available.
WhoWeServeSection.studentsDescription: Whether you're preparing for your first Model UN conference, Mock Trial competition, or math league tournament, our beginner-friendly programs help you develop public speaking, debate, critical thinking, and teamwork skills. Join 500+ students who have discovered their potential through academic competitions.
WhoWeServeSection.parentsDescription: Looking for meaningful extracurricular activities that prepare your child for high school, magnet school admissions, and college? JAMUN's affordable academic enrichment programs develop leadership, communication, problem-solving, and analytical thinking—skills that set students apart in applications and in life. Grants available for those who need them.
WhoWeServeSection.teachersDescription: Start a Model UN club, Mock Trial team, or Mathletes program at your school with our free curriculum guides and training materials. We support educators with position paper templates, competition prep resources, MATHCOUNTS practice problems, and ongoing mentorship to build successful programs.

ProgramsSection.title: Three Paths to Academic Excellence
ProgramsSection.subtitle: Choose from our flagship programs, each designed to develop different skills while making learning engaging and competitive.
ProgramsSection.modelUNDescription: Simulate UN committees, represent countries, and debate global issues. Perfect for students interested in international relations, public speaking, and diplomacy.
ProgramsSection.mockTrialDescription: Experience the courtroom firsthand as attorneys and witnesses. Develop argumentation, evidence analysis, and persuasive presentation skills.
ProgramsSection.mathletesDescription: Challenge yourself with competitive mathematics and problem-solving contests. Build analytical thinking and teamwork through math team competitions.

WhyChooseSection.title: Everything You Need to Excel
WhyChooseSection.subtitle: We're not just another academic program. We're a movement to make competitive academics accessible to every middle school student.
WhyChooseSection.feature1Description: Access expertly curated material for Model UN, Mock Trial, and Mathletes. Our modules are designed to be engaging, practical, and highly effective for competition prep.
WhyChooseSection.feature2Description: Compete with peers globally! Our dynamic leaderboards track progress across multiple subjects and competitions, offering recognition for top performers.
WhyChooseSection.feature3Description: It doesn't matter whether this is your first tournament or your hundredth! Our library of prep materials will make sure you are ready to compete at your best.
WhyChooseSection.youthLedDescription: Founded and run by students who understand what middle schoolers need.
WhyChooseSection.affordableDescription: Free resources and low-cost conferences with grants covering up to 100% of costs.
WhyChooseSection.provenDescription: Students develop skills that translate to academic success and beyond.
WhyChooseSection.communityDescription: Join a network of passionate students, educators, and volunteers.

SkillsSection.title: Essential Skills for Academic & Career Success
SkillsSection.subtitle: JAMUN's academic competition programs develop the critical skills that colleges, employers, and magnet schools look for. Students who participate in Model UN, Mock Trial, and Mathletes consistently outperform their peers.
SkillsSection.skill1Description: Develop confidence speaking in front of audiences through Model UN speeches, Mock Trial arguments, and team presentations. Students learn to articulate ideas clearly and persuasively.
SkillsSection.skill2Description: Learn to analyze complex problems, evaluate evidence, and form logical arguments. These skills transfer directly to academic success and standardized test performance.
SkillsSection.skill3Description: Master the art of constructing compelling arguments, responding to counterpoints, and persuading audiences. Essential skills for Mock Trial advocacy and Model UN diplomacy.
SkillsSection.skill4Description: Develop strong research skills writing Model UN position papers, case briefs, and analytical reports. Learn to find credible sources and synthesize information effectively.
SkillsSection.skill5Description: Work with peers to draft resolutions, prepare Mock Trial cases, and solve math problems as a team. Learn to leverage diverse perspectives and build consensus.
SkillsSection.skill6Description: Tackle challenging problems in Mathletes competitions, negotiate diplomatic solutions in Model UN, and develop case strategies in Mock Trial. Build creative problem-solving abilities.
SkillsSection.skill7Description: Take leadership roles as committee chairs, team captains, and bloc leaders. Students develop the confidence to guide others and drive collaborative outcomes.
SkillsSection.skill8Description: Prepare for MATHCOUNTS, AMC 8, regional Mock Trial competitions, and Model UN conferences. Build a track record of achievement for high school and college applications.
SkillsSection.seoTitle: Why Academic Competitions Matter for Middle School Students
SkillsSection.seoParagraph1: Research shows that students who participate in academic competitions like Model UN, Mock Trial, and math leagues demonstrate stronger performance on standardized tests, higher GPAs, and better college admission rates. These extracurricular activities develop essential 21st-century skills that can't be taught in traditional classrooms alone.
SkillsSection.seoParagraph2: Starting in middle school (grades 5-8) gives students a significant advantage. They build foundational skills in public speaking, debate, and critical thinking that compound over time, making them more competitive for magnet school programs, high school honors tracks, and eventually college admissions.

TestimonialSection.author: Mr. Komie and Ms. Mastin

TestimonialSection.quotePart1: This was something they were passionate about, and they put in an extraordinary amount of time and care into putting together a learning experience our students will

FAQSection.title: Frequently Asked Questions
FAQSection.subtitle: Everything you need to know about getting started with Model UN, Mock Trial, and Mathletes.
FAQSection.reachOut: We're here to help. Reach out to our team and we'll get back to you within 24 hours.
FAQSection.faq1Question: What is Model UN and how does it benefit middle school students?
FAQSection.faq1Answer: Model UN (Model United Nations) is an educational simulation where students represent different countries and debate global issues as UN delegates. For middle school students in grades 5-8, Model UN develops critical skills including public speaking, research, diplomatic negotiation, and understanding of international relations. Students learn to write position papers, draft resolutions, and deliver speeches—skills that prepare them for high school debate, magnet school applications, and future college success.
FAQSection.faq2Question: How do I prepare for my first Mock Trial competition?
FAQSection.faq2Answer: We provide comprehensive Mock Trial preparation materials including case analysis guides, opening statement templates, cross-examination techniques, and practice sessions. New participants learn courtroom procedures, evidence rules, and objection strategies through step-by-step tutorials. Our experienced mentors help students master both attorney and witness roles, building confidence in legal reasoning and persuasive argumentation.
FAQSection.faq3Question: What math competitions does JAMUN prepare students for?
FAQSection.faq3Answer: Our Mathletes program prepares middle school students for competitions including MATHCOUNTS, AMC 8, Math League, and Math Olympiad. We provide practice problems covering number theory, algebra, geometry, and problem-solving strategies. Students develop speed, accuracy, and creative mathematical thinking through team-based learning and individual challenges.
FAQSection.faq4Answer: Yes! JAMUN is committed to making academic competitions accessible to all students regardless of financial circumstances. All of our resources, curriculum guides, and training materials are completely free. Our conferences are low-cost, and we offer a grant program that can subsidize up to 100% of conference costs for students who need financial assistance. This includes registration fees, travel costs, and competition materials. As a 501(c)(3) nonprofit, all donations directly support student programs and our grant fund.
FAQSection.faq5Question: How can my school start a Model UN club or academic team?
FAQSection.faq5Answer: JAMUN provides complete startup kits for schools including free curriculum guides, training materials, position paper templates, and ongoing mentorship. Whether you want to start a Model UN club, Mock Trial team, or Mathletes program, we offer free resources and support for educators. Contact us to schedule a consultation where we'll help you create an implementation plan tailored to your school's needs.
FAQSection.faq6Question: Do academic competitions help with college admissions?
FAQSection.faq6Answer: Academic competitions demonstrate intellectual curiosity, leadership, and commitment—qualities college admissions officers value highly. Model UN, Mock Trial, and Mathletes develop transferable skills like public speaking, critical thinking, teamwork, and time management. Students who participate in these activities from middle school build impressive track records that strengthen high school and college applications.
FAQSection.faq7Question: What skills do students develop in JAMUN programs?
FAQSection.faq7Answer: JAMUN programs develop essential 21st-century skills including public speaking and debate, critical thinking and analysis, research and writing, teamwork and collaboration, leadership and confidence, and problem-solving abilities. These skills transfer to academic success, standardized test performance, and future career readiness.

AboutPage.title: About Us | JAMUN
AboutPage.description: Learn about JAMUN's mission to make academic competitions accessible to middle school students. 100% youth-led nonprofit organization.
AboutPage.heroDescription: JAMUN (Junior Assembly of the Model United Nations) is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization run entirely by passionate high school and college student volunteers. We provide Model UN, Mock Trial, and Mathletes programs for middle school students in grades 5-8—with free resources and low-cost conferences, plus grants for those who need them—because we believe academic competition should be exciting, accessible, and—most importantly—fun.
AboutPage.heroImageAlt: JAMUN volunteers and participants at conference
AboutPage.missionParagraph1: We believe every middle school student deserves the chance to discover their potential through academic competition. Research shows that students who participate in Model UN, debate, Mock Trial, and math competitions develop stronger public speaking, critical thinking, and leadership skills—abilities that transfer directly to academic success and college readiness.
AboutPage.missionParagraph2: JAMUN exists to make these transformative experiences accessible to all. We provide free and low-cost programs in Model UN (diplomatic simulation), Mock Trial (courtroom advocacy), and Mathletes (competitive mathematics)—designed specifically for students in grades 5-8. Our goal isn't just to teach skills; it's to spark a lifelong love of learning that prepares students for magnet schools, high school honors programs, and college admissions.
AboutPage.missionQuote: We're not just running tournaments. We're showing kids that being smart is cool, that hard work pays off, and that they can accomplish incredible things.
AboutPage.timelineSubtitle: The story of how a group of passionate students built something bigger than themselves.
AboutPage.timeline2023Description: JAMUN was founded by a small group of high school students who saw a gap: middle schoolers were being left behind in academic competitions. We decided to change that.
AboutPage.timeline2024Description: Our first conferences took flight. What started as a single Model UN event expanded to include Mock Trial and Mathletes, reaching students across multiple states.
AboutPage.timeline2025Description: JAMUN earned 501(c)(3) nonprofit status. Our volunteer base grew to 80+, and we raised over $70,000 to make programs accessible to all.
AboutPage.timelineTodayDescription: With 500+ students impacted and 30+ schools reached, we're just getting started. Our mission remains the same: make academics fun for every student.
AboutPage.valuesSubtitle: These principles guide everything we do at JAMUN.
AboutPage.valuePassionDescription: We believe that genuine enthusiasm is contagious. Our volunteers bring energy and excitement that transforms academic competition into an adventure.
AboutPage.valueCommunityDescription: We're building more than programs—we're building a supportive family where every student feels they belong, regardless of experience level.
AboutPage.valueInnovationDescription: As a youth-led organization, we think differently. We constantly reimagine how to make learning engaging and competitions accessible.
AboutPage.valueExcellenceDescription: We hold ourselves to the highest standards because our students deserve nothing less. Quality in everything we create.
AboutPage.teamSubtitle: A dedicated group of student leaders working to make academics accessible and exciting.
AboutPage.teamMember1Description: Student at Duke University studying mathematics and computer science. Passionate about making academic competitions accessible to all students.
AboutPage.teamMember2Description: Volleyball player with a keen interest in politics and international relations. Dedicated to fostering diplomatic skills in young delegates.
AboutPage.teamMember3Description: Tennis enthusiast studying mathematics. Committed to helping students develop critical thinking and advocacy skills through legal simulation.
AboutPage.teamMember4Description: Former Mathletes champion who studied advanced mathematics. Passionate about philanthropy and expanding math competition opportunities.
AboutPage.teamSupportText: Our leadership team is supported by
AboutPage.teamSupportTextEnd: who share our passion for empowering young learners. Together, we're proving that students can create real, lasting change.
AboutPage.impactSubtitle: Every number represents a student inspired, a school empowered, or a volunteer who gave their time to make a difference.
AboutPage.ctaDescription: Whether you're a student ready to compete, a teacher looking to start a program, or someone who wants to support our mission—there's a place for you at JAMUN.

ProgramsPage.title: Programs | JAMUN
ProgramsPage.description: Explore JAMUN's academic competition programs: Model UN, Mock Trial, and Mathletes for middle school students grades 5-8.
ProgramsPage.heroSubtitle: Whether you love debating global issues in Model UN, arguing cases in Mock Trial court, or solving challenging math problems in Mathletes competitions—we have a program that will ignite your passion and build skills for high school, college, and beyond. All designed specifically for middle school students in grades 5-8, all beginner-friendly.
ProgramsPage.statsTitle: Academic Competitions Built for Middle School Students
ProgramsPage.statsSubtitle: Every program is designed specifically for grades 5-8, with no prior experience required. Build public speaking, critical thinking, and leadership skills that prepare you for magnet schools, high school honors tracks, and college admissions.
ProgramsPage.modelUNDescription: Step into the shoes of UN delegates and tackle real-world global issues. Model UN develops critical thinking, public speaking, and negotiation skills while building deep understanding of international relations.
ProgramsPage.modelUNLongDescription: Model United Nations simulates the United Nations where students represent different countries and debate global issues. Delegates research their assigned country's positions, write position papers, give speeches, and work with others to draft resolutions addressing world challenges like climate change, human rights, and international security.
ProgramsPage.modelUNFeature1Description: Deliver speeches, respond to questions, and articulate your country's position clearly.
ProgramsPage.modelUNFeature2Description: Work with other delegates to build coalitions and draft consensus resolutions.
ProgramsPage.modelUNFeature3Description: Learn to research complex topics and understand multiple perspectives on global issues.
ProgramsPage.modelUNFeature4Description: Practice diplomatic negotiation, compromise, and persuasion in a professional setting.
ProgramsPage.modelUNLearn1: How the United Nations and international diplomacy work
ProgramsPage.modelUNLearn2: Research and analysis of complex global issues
ProgramsPage.modelUNLearn3: Public speaking and formal debate techniques
ProgramsPage.modelUNLearn4: Writing position papers and draft resolutions
ProgramsPage.modelUNTestimonialQuote: Model UN taught me that I could speak up and be heard. It changed how I see myself and my ability to make a difference.
ProgramsPage.mockTrialDescription: Experience the drama of the courtroom as attorneys and witnesses bring cases to life. Mock Trial develops argumentation, critical analysis, and presentation skills that translate to success in any field.
ProgramsPage.mockTrialLongDescription: Mock Trial is a competitive simulation where students take on the roles of attorneys and witnesses to argue a fictional legal case. Teams prepare both prosecution/plaintiff and defense sides, learning to craft opening statements, conduct direct and cross-examinations, and deliver closing arguments before real judges.
ProgramsPage.mockTrialFeature1Description: Learn to construct logical arguments, analyze evidence, and think like a lawyer.
ProgramsPage.mockTrialFeature2Description: Dissect complex cases, identify key facts, and develop winning strategies.
ProgramsPage.mockTrialFeature3Description: Master the art of questioning witnesses through direct and cross-examination.
ProgramsPage.mockTrialFeature4Description: Bring witnesses to life and deliver compelling arguments that persuade judges.
ProgramsPage.mockTrialLearn1: Fundamentals of the American legal system
ProgramsPage.mockTrialLearn2: How to construct and refute legal arguments
ProgramsPage.mockTrialTestimonialQuote: Mock Trial pushed me out of my comfort zone. Now I can think on my feet and argue my point confidently.
ProgramsPage.mockTrialTestimonialAuthor: Dustin Simon, Director of Mock Trial
ProgramsPage.mathletesDescription: Challenge yourself with competitive mathematics and discover the thrill of problem-solving. Mathletes builds analytical thinking, perseverance, and teamwork through engaging math competitions.
ProgramsPage.mathletesLongDescription: Mathletes is a competitive mathematics program where students tackle challenging problems ranging from arithmetic and algebra to geometry and number theory. Students compete individually and as teams, developing speed, accuracy, and creative problem-solving approaches while building a supportive math community.
ProgramsPage.mathletesFeature1Description: Develop creative approaches to challenging problems beyond standard curriculum.
ProgramsPage.mathletesFeature2Description: Build computational fluency and confidence in time-pressured situations.
ProgramsPage.mathletesFeature3Description: Collaborate on relay rounds and team challenges that require coordination.
ProgramsPage.mathletesFeature4Description: Earn awards and recognition for mathematical achievement at competitions.
ProgramsPage.mathletesTestimonialQuote: Mathematics isn't just about numbers—it's about developing the problem-solving mindset that unlocks every door in life.
ProgramsPage.whyChooseSubtitle: Every program is designed with middle schoolers in mind—accessible, supportive, and genuinely fun.
ProgramsPage.whyChooseBeginnerDescription: No experience needed. We teach everything from the ground up with patient, supportive mentors.
ProgramsPage.whyChooseCompetitionsDescription: Compete in actual tournaments and conferences, earning recognition and building your resume.
ProgramsPage.whyChooseResourcesDescription: Access training materials, practice problems, and curriculum guides at no cost.
ProgramsPage.whyChooseSkillsDescription: Build transferable skills in communication, critical thinking, and teamwork.
ProgramsPage.ctaSubtitle: Whether you're a student eager to compete or a teacher looking to start a program at your school, we're here to help you take the first step.

Your tax-deductible donation to our 501(c)(3) nonprofit directly funds academic competitions, training materials, and grants that empower the next generation of public speakers, debaters, and problem-solvers.

DonatePage.reason3: Building the next generation of leaders and critical thinkers
DonatePage.reason4: Making academic competitions accessible to all

DonatePage.ctaDescription: Right now, there are students who have never had the opportunity to compete, debate, or discover their potential. You can change that today.
DonatePage.ctaFootnote: Every gift, no matter the size, makes a difference.
DonatePage.testimonialQuote: Before JAMUN, I never thought I could speak in front of people. Now I'm leading my school's Model UN team. This program changed my life.

RegisterPage.title: Register | JAMUN
RegisterPage.description: Register for JAMUN academic competitions and conferences. Join Model UN, Mock Trial, or Mathletes programs.

GrantsPage.title: Grants | JAMUN
GrantsPage.description: Apply for JAMUN grants to subsidize conference costs. Financial assistance available for students who need support.
GrantsPage.heroDescription: JAMUN provides grants and financial assistance for middle school students (grades 5-8) to participate in Model UN conferences, Mock Trial competitions, and Mathletes tournaments. Our 501(c)(3) nonprofit has given over $25K in grants to help cover registration fees, travel costs, and competition materials. No student should miss out on building public speaking, critical thinking, and leadership skills due to cost.
GrantsPage.whySubtitle: Our grants remove barriers and open doors to life-changing experiences in academic competition.
GrantsPage.benefit1Description: Cover registration fees, travel costs, and materials so no student is left behind due to financial constraints.
GrantsPage.benefit2Description: Provide resources and training that help students reach their full potential faster than ever before.
GrantsPage.benefit3Description: Connect students with mentors, peers, and opportunities that extend far beyond their local community.
GrantsPage.featuredQuote: The JAMUN grant made it possible for my son to participate in Model UN. It changed his perspective on global issues and sparked a passion for social studies that has shaped his entire academic journey.
GrantsPage.howSubtitle: Our streamlined application process makes it easy to apply for the support you need.
GrantsPage.step1Description: Fill out our simple online form with your information and grant request details. It takes just 10-15 minutes.
GrantsPage.step2Description: Our team reviews applications within 2-3 weeks and may reach out for additional information if needed.
GrantsPage.step3Description: You'll be notified of the decision via email with clear next steps if approved.
GrantsPage.step4Description: Approved grants are disbursed directly to cover your specified expenses. It's that simple.
GrantsPage.whatDescription: Our grants are flexible and designed to cover the full range of expenses that might stand between a student and their chance to compete. We work with each applicant to understand their unique needs.
GrantsPage.testimonialsSubtitle: Hear from families, teachers, and students whose lives have been changed by JAMUN grants.
GrantsPage.testimonial1Quote: The JAMUN grant made it possible for my son to participate in Model UN. It changed his perspective on global issues and sparked a passion for social studies.
GrantsPage.testimonial2Quote: Our school couldn't afford to start a new extracurricular. Now we have 30 students participating in Model UN conferences twice a year!
GrantsPage.testimonial3Quote: The JAMUN grant gave me the opportunity to attend my first Model UN conference. It was an experience that changed my perspective on the world.
GrantsPage.ctaTitle: Ready to Apply for a Grant?
GrantsPage.ctaDescription: Fill out a short application and our team will review it within 2-3 weeks. Don't let cost stand in the way of your potential.
GrantsPage.ctaRedirectNote: You'll be redirected to Google Forms to complete your application.
GrantsPage.questionsDescription: We're here to help. Reach out to our grants team for assistance with your application or to learn more about our funding opportunities. No question is too small.

BlogPage.title: Blog | JAMUN
BlogPage.description: Read articles, guides, and updates from JAMUN about Model UN, Mock Trial, Mathletes, and academic competitions.

ModelUNPage.title: Model UN | JAMUN
ModelUNPage.description: Learn about Model UN at JAMUN. Debate global issues, draft resolutions, and develop diplomacy skills as a UN delegate.

MockTrialPage.title: Mock Trial | JAMUN
MockTrialPage.description: Explore Mock Trial at JAMUN. Learn legal reasoning, courtroom procedures, and persuasive speaking through simulated trials.

MathletesPage.title: Mathletes | JAMUN
MathletesPage.description: Discover Mathletes at JAMUN. Compete in math challenges and prepare for MATHCOUNTS, AMC 8, and other competitions.

NotFoundPage.title: Page Not Found | JAMUN
NotFoundPage.heading: Page Not Found
NotFoundPage.description: Sorry, we couldn't find the page you're looking for. It may have been moved or doesn't exist.

ModelUNHomePage.heroDescription: Step into the shoes of UN delegates and debate pressing global issues like climate change, human rights, and international security. Our Model UN program for middle school students (grades 5-8) develops public speaking, research, and diplomatic negotiation skills through beginner-friendly conferences. Learn to write position papers, draft resolutions, and build coalitions with fellow delegates.
ModelUNHomePage.heroImageAlt: Model UN delegate raising placard during committee session
ModelUNHomePage.statsTitle: JAMUN Model UN by the Numbers
ModelUNHomePage.statsSubtitle: Join a growing community of young diplomats making their voices heard.
ModelUNHomePage.aboutParagraph1: Model United Nations (MUN) is an educational simulation where students take on the role of delegates representing different countries at the United Nations. You'll research real nations, debate actual global issues, and work with other delegates to craft solutions through resolutions.
ModelUNHomePage.aboutParagraph2: It's more than just debate—it's diplomacy, research, public speaking, and collaboration all rolled into one exciting experience. Whether you're passionate about climate change, human rights, or international security, Model UN gives you a platform to explore these issues from a global perspective.
ModelUNHomePage.aboutQuote: Model UN taught me that every voice matters in shaping our world's future.
ModelUNHomePage.delegateTitle: What You'll Do as a Delegate
ModelUNHomePage.delegateSubtitle: From research to resolution—here's how you'll make your mark in committee.
ModelUNHomePage.delegateActivity1Description: Dive deep into your assigned nation's history, politics, economy, and stance on global issues. Become the expert.
ModelUNHomePage.delegateActivity2Description: Craft compelling documents that outline your country's position and proposed solutions to world challenges.
ModelUNHomePage.delegateActivity3Description: Take the floor to address the committee, articulate your positions, and respond to questions from other delegates.
ModelUNHomePage.delegateActivity4Description: Work with allies to draft resolutions, negotiate compromises, and build consensus on complex issues.
ModelUNHomePage.skillsSubtitle: The skills you develop in Model UN will serve you in school, career, and life.
ModelUNHomePage.skill1Description: Gain confidence speaking in front of groups, structuring arguments, and thinking on your feet.
ModelUNHomePage.skill2Description: Analyze complex problems from multiple perspectives and develop creative solutions.
ModelUNHomePage.skill3Description: Learn to work with others, build consensus, and navigate diplomatic challenges.
ModelUNHomePage.skill4Description: Develop strong research skills and learn to write persuasive, well-structured documents.
ModelUNHomePage.skillsTestimonial: Before Model UN, I was terrified of public speaking. Now I volunteer to give presentations in class. It completely changed how I see myself.
ModelUNHomePage.conferenceSubtitle: From opening ceremonies to awards, here's what to expect at a JAMUN conference.
ModelUNHomePage.conferenceStep1Description: Conferences begin with inspiring speakers and orientation to set the tone for productive diplomacy.
ModelUNHomePage.conferenceStep2Description: Delegates debate topics, deliver speeches, and work in blocs to draft working papers and resolutions.
ModelUNHomePage.conferenceStep3Description: Informal negotiation time where delegates move freely, form alliances, and draft collaborative documents.
ModelUNHomePage.conferenceStep4Description: Committees vote on resolutions, and outstanding delegates are recognized with awards and honors.
ModelUNHomePage.conferenceImageAlt: Students receiving awards at JAMUN conference
ModelUNHomePage.committeesSubtitle: Explore the kinds of committees and topics you might encounter at our conferences.
ModelUNHomePage.committeesRotateNote: Topics rotate each conference. Check our
ModelUNHomePage.resourcesSubtitle: Everything you need to prepare for your next conference—all free and designed for middle schoolers.
ModelUNHomePage.resource1Title: A Short Guide to the Crisis
ModelUNHomePage.resource1Description: Learn how crisis committees work, from backroom notes to directives.
ModelUNHomePage.resource2Description: A structured template for writing crisis committee position papers.
ModelUNHomePage.resource3Description: A template for writing crisis committee directives.
ModelUNHomePage.resource4Description: A template for writing General Assembly draft resolutions.
ModelUNHomePage.resource5Description: Everything you need to know about motions, points, and debate rules.
ModelUNHomePage.resource6Description: Step-by-step instructions for researching your assigned country.
ModelUNHomePage.faqSubtitle: Everything you need to know about getting started with Model UN.
ModelUNHomePage.faq1Question: Do I need any experience to join Model UN?
ModelUNHomePage.faq1Answer: Not at all! Our program is designed specifically for beginners. We'll teach you everything from how to research your country to parliamentary procedure. Many of our most successful delegates started with zero experience.
ModelUNHomePage.faq2Answer: JAMUN Model UN is designed for middle school students in grades 5-8. We create age-appropriate committees and topics that challenge students while remaining accessible.
ModelUNHomePage.faq3Question: How much time does Model UN require?
ModelUNHomePage.faq3Answer: Typically, clubs meet weekly for 1-2 hours. Before conferences, delegates spend additional time researching their country and preparing speeches. Conferences are usually 1-2 days on weekends.
ModelUNHomePage.faq4Answer: Topics range from climate change and human rights to technology regulation and international security. We select topics that are relevant, engaging, and appropriate for middle schoolers to explore.
ModelUNHomePage.faq5Question: Is there a cost to participate?
ModelUNHomePage.faq5Answer: We work hard to keep costs minimal. Many of our resources are free, and we offer financial assistance for conference registration fees. No student should be unable to participate due to cost.
ModelUNHomePage.faq6Answer: Delegates can earn awards like Best Delegate, Outstanding Delegate, and Honorable Mention based on their preparation, speaking skills, collaboration, and adherence to their country's positions.
ModelUNHomePage.ctaDescription: Whether you're a student ready to represent nations on the world stage or a teacher looking to start a Model UN club, we're here to help you take the first step.
ModelUNHomePage.ctaContactText: Questions? Reach out to our Model UN team at

MockTrialHomePage.heroDescription: Experience the drama of the courtroom in our Mock Trial program for middle school students (grades 5-8). Learn to craft opening statements, conduct cross-examinations, and deliver closing arguments before real judges. Develop critical thinking, public speaking, and legal reasoning skills that prepare you for high school debate and future success.
MockTrialHomePage.heroFloatingSubtitle: Be Among the First to Join
MockTrialHomePage.heroImageAlt: Mock Trial students receiving awards in courtroom
MockTrialHomePage.statsTitle: JAMUN Mock Trial at a Glance
MockTrialHomePage.statsSubtitle: A brand new program launching Fall 2026—be among the founding members.
MockTrialHomePage.aboutParagraph1: Mock Trial is a competitive simulation where students take on the roles of attorneys and witnesses to argue a fictional legal case. Teams prepare both prosecution/plaintiff and defense sides, learning to craft opening statements, conduct direct and cross-examinations, and deliver closing arguments before real judges.
MockTrialHomePage.aboutParagraph2: It's more than just public speaking—it's critical thinking, teamwork, and performance combined. Whether you dream of being a lawyer or just want to build confidence, Mock Trial gives you skills that last a lifetime.
MockTrialHomePage.aboutQuote: Mock Trial pushed me out of my comfort zone. Now I can think on my feet and argue my point confidently.
MockTrialHomePage.courtroomTitle: What You'll Do in Mock Trial
MockTrialHomePage.courtroomSubtitle: From case analysis to closing arguments—here's how you'll make your case in the courtroom.
MockTrialHomePage.courtroomActivity1Description: Study the case materials, identify key facts and legal issues, and develop your team's theory of the case.
MockTrialHomePage.courtroomActivity2Description: Craft compelling opening statements, closing arguments, and examination questions that tell a persuasive story.
MockTrialHomePage.courtroomActivity3Description: Conduct direct examinations to tell your story and cross-examinations to challenge the opposing side.
MockTrialHomePage.courtroomActivity4Description: Present your case to real attorneys and judges, responding to objections and adapting in real-time.
MockTrialHomePage.skillsSubtitle: The skills you develop in Mock Trial will serve you in school, career, and life.
MockTrialHomePage.skill1Description: Learn to present arguments clearly and convince judges with logic and evidence.
MockTrialHomePage.skill2Description: Break down complex situations, identify weaknesses in arguments, and think strategically.
MockTrialHomePage.skill3Description: Coordinate with teammates to build a cohesive case strategy and support each other.
MockTrialHomePage.skill4Description: Respond to unexpected objections and adapt your approach on the fly.
MockTrialHomePage.skillsTestimonial: I never thought I'd love public speaking, but Mock Trial changed that. Now I volunteer to present in class and I'm not afraid to speak up for what I believe in.
MockTrialHomePage.formatSubtitle: From opening statements to the final verdict, here's what to expect in competition.
MockTrialHomePage.formatStep1Description: Each side presents their theory of the case and previews the evidence they'll present to the judge.
MockTrialHomePage.formatStep2Description: Attorneys call witnesses for direct examination, then the opposing side cross-examines to challenge their testimony.
MockTrialHomePage.formatStep3Description: Attorneys object to improper questions or evidence, and must know the rules to protect their case.
MockTrialHomePage.formatStep4Description: Each side summarizes the evidence and makes their final persuasive appeal to the judge or jury.
MockTrialHomePage.formatImageAlt: Award ceremony handshake at Mock Trial
MockTrialHomePage.caseParagraph1: On March 3, 2025, Briarwood University senior Ethan Morales was found dead in the chemistry lab after a toxic gas release. His lab partner, Alex Morgan, had left the room minutes before the alarms sounded. Was this a tragic accident—or calculated murder?
MockTrialHomePage.caseParagraph2: Teams will argue both sides of this gripping case, examining security footage, mislabeled chemicals, missing notebook pages, and the heated rivalry between two competitive research partners fighting for academic credit.
MockTrialHomePage.resourcesSubtitle: Everything you need to prepare for Mock Trial—all free and designed for middle schoolers.
MockTrialHomePage.resource1Description: An introduction to Mock Trial format, roles, and how competitions work.
MockTrialHomePage.resource2Description: Quick reference for common objections and when to use them in trial.
MockTrialHomePage.resource3Description: A structured template for crafting compelling opening statements.
MockTrialHomePage.resource4Description: Learn the art of effective cross-examination with leading questions.
MockTrialHomePage.resource5Description: A student-friendly guide to the most important evidence rules.
MockTrialHomePage.resource6Description: How to structure a powerful closing that brings your case together.
MockTrialHomePage.faqSubtitle: Everything you need to know about getting started with Mock Trial.
MockTrialHomePage.faq1Question: Do I need any experience to join Mock Trial?
MockTrialHomePage.faq1Answer: Not at all! Our program is designed specifically for beginners. We'll teach you everything from courtroom basics to advanced examination techniques. Many of our best attorneys started with no prior experience.
MockTrialHomePage.faq2Answer: JAMUN Mock Trial is designed for middle school students in grades 5-8. We create age-appropriate cases and provide training that meets students where they are.
MockTrialHomePage.faq3Answer: Mock Trial begins in Fall 2026! We're currently building our program and will open registration soon. Join our mailing list to be the first to know when registration opens.
MockTrialHomePage.faq4Answer: Students can be attorneys (who argue the case) or witnesses (who testify). Most students try both roles during practice, and many discover hidden talents they didn't know they had!
MockTrialHomePage.faq5Question: How much time does Mock Trial require?
MockTrialHomePage.faq5Answer: Mock Trial involves about 5 hours per week with weekly club meetings and year-round programming. We work with students to balance academics and extracurriculars.
MockTrialHomePage.faq6Question: Is there a cost to participate?
MockTrialHomePage.faq6Answer: We work hard to keep costs minimal and offer financial assistance for competition fees. No student should be unable to participate due to cost.
MockTrialHomePage.ctaDescription: We're building something special. Whether you're a student ready to argue cases in the courtroom or a teacher looking to start a Mock Trial program, join our interest list to be the first to know when we launch.
MockTrialHomePage.ctaContactText: Questions? Reach out to our Mock Trial team at

MathletesHomePage.heroDescription: Prepare for MATHCOUNTS, AMC 8, and Math League competitions in our Mathletes program for middle school students (grades 5-8). Master number theory, algebra, geometry, and creative problem-solving strategies through team-based learning. Build speed, accuracy, and mathematical confidence that sets you apart in academics and competitions.
MathletesHomePage.heroFloatingSubtitle: Be Among the First to Join
MathletesHomePage.statsSubtitle: A brand new program launching Fall 2026—be among the founding members.
MathletesHomePage.aboutParagraph1: Mathletes is a competitive mathematics program where students challenge themselves with problems that go beyond the classroom. Think of it as a sport for your brain—with individual events, team competitions, and the thrill of solving problems under pressure.
MathletesHomePage.aboutParagraph2: It's not about memorizing formulas—it's about creative thinking, pattern recognition, and the satisfaction of cracking a tough problem. Whether you love puzzles or want to strengthen your math skills, Mathletes makes math genuinely exciting.
MathletesHomePage.aboutQuote: Math used to be just homework. Now it's my favorite puzzle to solve with friends.
MathletesHomePage.experienceTitle: What You'll Do as a Mathlete
MathletesHomePage.experienceSubtitle: From practice sessions to competition day—here's how you'll grow as a problem-solver.
MathletesHomePage.experienceActivity1Description: Master creative approaches to math problems that go beyond textbook methods. Discover elegant solutions.
MathletesHomePage.experienceActivity2Description: Work through challenging problems with teammates and coaches, building speed and accuracy.
MathletesHomePage.experienceActivity3Description: Collaborate with teammates in relay rounds and team challenges where every member contributes.
MathletesHomePage.experienceActivity4Description: Compete for individual and team awards at regional and national competitions.
MathletesHomePage.skillsSubtitle: The skills you develop in Mathletes will serve you in school, career, and life.
MathletesHomePage.skill1Description: Develop systematic approaches to breaking down complex problems into manageable steps.
MathletesHomePage.skill2Description: Build lightning-fast calculation skills and number sense that serve you in all areas.
MathletesHomePage.skill3Description: Learn to identify patterns, make predictions, and choose the best approach to each problem.
MathletesHomePage.skill4Description: Work with teammates to solve problems faster together than you could alone.
MathletesHomePage.skillsTestimonial: Mathletes taught me that getting stuck is just part of the process. Now I actually enjoy the challenge of figuring things out.
MathletesHomePage.formatSubtitle: From sprint rounds to countdown brackets, here's what to expect at a competition.
MathletesHomePage.formatStep1Description: Individual challenge: 30 problems in 40 minutes testing accuracy and speed across all math topics.
MathletesHomePage.formatStep2Description: Pairs of challenging problems with 6 minutes each. Focus on deep problem-solving over speed.
MathletesHomePage.formatStep3Description: Work together with your team of 4 to solve 10 problems in 20 minutes. Collaboration is key.
MathletesHomePage.formatStep4Description: Head-to-head bracket tournament for top scorers. First to buzz in with the correct answer advances.
MathletesHomePage.formatImageAlt: Students taking a break during competition
MathletesHomePage.topicsSubtitle: Explore the math concepts you'll master through practice and competition.
MathletesHomePage.topicsNote: Topics expand as you advance. Our curriculum grows with you from beginner to competition-ready.
MathletesHomePage.resourcesSubtitle: Everything you need to prepare for competition—all free and designed for middle schoolers.
MathletesHomePage.resource1Description: An introduction to competitive math and how to begin your Mathletes journey.
MathletesHomePage.resource2Description: Curated problems organized by difficulty and topic for daily practice.
MathletesHomePage.resource3Description: Essential formulas and theorems you'll need for competition success.
MathletesHomePage.resource4Description: Techniques for faster calculations and building number sense.
MathletesHomePage.resource5Description: Learn systematic approaches like working backwards and finding patterns.
MathletesHomePage.resource6Description: Real problems from previous competitions with detailed solutions.
MathletesHomePage.faqSubtitle: Everything you need to know about getting started with Mathletes.
MathletesHomePage.faq1Question: Do I need to be a math genius to join Mathletes?
MathletesHomePage.faq1Answer: Not at all! Mathletes is for students who enjoy math and want to challenge themselves. We welcome all skill levels and provide training that helps everyone improve. Some of our best competitors started with no competition experience.
MathletesHomePage.faq2Answer: JAMUN Mathletes is designed for middle school students in grades 5-8. We create age-appropriate practice materials and competition divisions so students compete with peers at similar levels.
MathletesHomePage.faq3Answer: Mathletes begins in Fall 2026! We're currently building our curriculum and partnerships. Join our mailing list to be the first to know when registration opens.
MathletesHomePage.faq4Question: How much time does Mathletes require?
MathletesHomePage.faq4Answer: Mathletes involves about 4 hours per week with meetings every two weeks and 4 tournaments per year. Students are encouraged to do additional individual practice, but the time commitment is flexible based on your goals.
MathletesHomePage.faq5Question: What math level do I need?
MathletesHomePage.faq5Answer: If you're comfortable with pre-algebra concepts, you're ready to start! Our training covers topics from basic arithmetic through introductory algebra and geometry.
MathletesHomePage.faq6Question: Is there a cost to participate?
MathletesHomePage.faq6Answer: We work hard to keep costs minimal. Many of our resources are free, and we offer financial assistance for competition registration fees. No student should be unable to participate due to cost.
MathletesHomePage.ctaDescription: We're building a program where math is exciting, challenging, and fun. Whether you're a student ready to test your skills or a teacher looking to start a Mathletes club, join our interest list to be the first to know when we launch.
MathletesHomePage.ctaContactText: Questions? Reach out to our Mathletes team at

PrivacyPage.title: Privacy Policy | JAMUN
PrivacyPage.description: Learn how JAMUN protects your privacy and handles your personal information.
PrivacyPage.introText: The Junior Assembly of Model United Nations ("JAMUN," "we," "us," or "our") is committed to protecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your information when you visit our website jamun.org and participate in our programs.
PrivacyPage.personalInfoText: We may collect personal information that you voluntarily provide to us when you:
PrivacyPage.personalInfoItem1: Register for our programs (Model UN, Mock Trial, or Mathletes)
PrivacyPage.personalInfoItem5: Apply for grants or volunteer positions
PrivacyPage.infoItem1: Name and contact information (email address, phone number)
PrivacyPage.infoItem4: Payment information (processed securely through third-party providers)
PrivacyPage.autoCollectText: When you visit our website, we may automatically collect certain information about your device, including your IP address, browser type, operating system, and browsing behavior. We use Google Analytics to help us understand how visitors use our site.
PrivacyPage.howUseText: We use the information we collect to:
PrivacyPage.howUseItem2: Communicate with participants, parents, and educators
PrivacyPage.howUseItem3: Process donations and issue tax receipts
PrivacyPage.howUseItem5: Send newsletters and program updates (with your consent)
PrivacyPage.infoSharingText: We do not sell, trade, or rent your personal information to third parties. We may share your information with:
PrivacyPage.infoSharingItem1: Service providers who assist us in operating our website and programs
PrivacyPage.infoSharingItem2: Schools and educators involved in our programs (with appropriate consent)
PrivacyPage.infoSharingItem3: Legal authorities when required by law
PrivacyPage.childrensPrivacyText: Our programs serve students in grades 5-8. We are committed to protecting the privacy of children. We collect information about minor participants only with parental or guardian consent and use it solely for program administration. Parents and guardians may contact us at any time to review, update, or delete their child's information.
PrivacyPage.photoVideoText1: JAMUN may take photographs and video recordings of participants at our events, conferences, and programs. These images and videos may be used for promotional and educational purposes, including but not limited to:
PrivacyPage.photoVideoItem1: Our website and social media channels
PrivacyPage.photoVideoText2: By registering for and participating in JAMUN programs, participants (and their parents/guardians for minors) consent to the use of their likeness in photographs and videos for these purposes. If you do not wish to have your child photographed or recorded, please notify us in writing at
PrivacyPage.photoVideoText3: prior to the event. We will make reasonable efforts to accommodate such requests, though we cannot guarantee complete exclusion from group photos or wide-angle shots.
PrivacyPage.dataSecurityText: We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect your personal information against unauthorized access, alteration, disclosure, or destruction. However, no method of transmission over the Internet is 100% secure.
PrivacyPage.yourRightsItem1: Access the personal information we hold about you
PrivacyPage.cookiesText: Our website uses cookies and similar technologies to enhance your browsing experience and collect analytics data. You can control cookie settings through your browser preferences.
PrivacyPage.changesToPolicyText: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new policy on this page and updating the "Last updated" date.
PrivacyPage.contactText: If you have questions about this Privacy Policy or our data practices, please contact us:

TermsPage.title: Terms of Service | JAMUN
TermsPage.description: Read JAMUN's terms of service for using our website and participating in our programs.
TermsPage.agreementText: By accessing or using the JAMUN website (jamun.org) and participating in our programs, you agree to be bound by these Terms of Service. If you do not agree to these terms, please do not use our website or services.
TermsPage.aboutText: The Junior Assembly of Model United Nations ("JAMUN") is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization that provides Model UN, Mock Trial, and Mathletes programs for students in grades 5-8. Our programs are designed to develop public speaking, critical thinking, and leadership skills.
TermsPage.eligibilityText: Our programs are primarily designed for students in grades 5-8. Participation in JAMUN programs requires registration and, for minor participants, parental or guardian consent.
TermsPage.conductItem1: Treat fellow participants, volunteers, and staff with respect
TermsPage.conductItem2: Follow the rules and guidelines of each program
TermsPage.conductItem4: Dress appropriately for conferences and events (Western business attire for Model UN)
TermsPage.conductItem5: Refrain from disruptive or inappropriate behavior
TermsPage.conductRemoval: JAMUN reserves the right to remove any participant who violates our code of conduct.
TermsPage.registrationText: Program registration fees, when applicable, are outlined during the registration process. Financial assistance is available for families who demonstrate need. Refund policies vary by program and will be communicated at the time of registration.
TermsPage.permittedUseText: You may use our website for lawful purposes related to learning about and participating in JAMUN programs. You agree not to:
TermsPage.permittedUseItem1: Use the website in any way that violates applicable laws
TermsPage.permittedUseItem2: Attempt to gain unauthorized access to our systems
TermsPage.permittedUseItem3: Interfere with the proper functioning of the website
TermsPage.permittedUseItem4: Copy, distribute, or modify website content without permission
TermsPage.permittedUseItem5: Use automated systems to access the website without our consent
TermsPage.userAccountsText: If you create an account on our website, you are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your login credentials and for all activities that occur under your account.
TermsPage.intellectualPropertyText1: All content on the JAMUN website, including text, graphics, logos, images, and educational materials, is the property of JAMUN or its content providers and is protected by copyright and other intellectual property laws.
TermsPage.intellectualPropertyText2: Educational resources provided by JAMUN may be used for personal, non-commercial educational purposes. Redistribution or commercial use requires written permission.
TermsPage.donationsText: JAMUN is a registered 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization. Donations are tax-deductible to the extent allowed by law. All donations are final and non-refundable unless otherwise required by law.
TermsPage.disclaimerText: The JAMUN website and services are provided "as is" without warranties of any kind, either express or implied. We do not guarantee that the website will be uninterrupted, error-free, or free of viruses or other harmful components.
TermsPage.liabilityText: To the fullest extent permitted by law, JAMUN and its volunteers, officers, and directors shall not be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages arising from your use of our website or participation in our programs.
TermsPage.indemnificationText: You agree to indemnify and hold harmless JAMUN, its volunteers, officers, and directors from any claims, damages, losses, or expenses arising from your violation of these Terms of Service or your use of our website and services.
TermsPage.changesToTermsText: We reserve the right to modify these Terms of Service at any time. Changes will be effective immediately upon posting to the website. Your continued use of the website after changes are posted constitutes acceptance of the modified terms.
TermsPage.governingLawText: These Terms of Service shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the United States, without regard to conflict of law principles.
TermsPage.contactText: If you have questions about these Terms of Service, please contact us:

LeaderboardPage.heroSubtitle: Track your school's progress and see how you stack up against the competition across all JAMUN programs.
LeaderboardPage.standingsSubtitle: Rankings are updated after each competition
LeaderboardPage.tieExplanation: Schools with the same score share their rank (indicated by "T")
LeaderboardPage.moversSubtitle: Schools making the biggest jumps in the rankings
LeaderboardPage.ctaSubtitle: Join one of our programs and start climbing the leaderboard with your school.
